chargeHist.descr: Possess Body Armor - Convicted V. Felon

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:51 AM Defendant Christopher Jamar Johnson II in court.  Attorney Eric P Habich in court for Christopher Jamar Johnson II.  Attorney Valerian Powell by email.  Defense requesting a little more time, just got discovery, state has extended an offer.  Set for another STC>
Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

12:24 PM Defendant Christopher Jamar Johnson II in court.  Attorney Eric P Habich in court for Christopher Jamar Johnson II.  Attorney Valerian Powell in court for State of Wisconsin. State asking that all counts be found transactionally related. CT finds all counts transactionally related. B.B duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Habich. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by State. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 13.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
